data.meta_description: Research Fellowship Grants & Young Clinician Investigator Awards As the premier funder of neurosurgical studies, the Neurosurgery Research & Education Foundation (NREF) provides funding for studies in basic, translational and patient-oriented clinical research annually for North American investigators. Research Fellowship Grant One year, up to $50,000 Open to residents only, the NREF Research Fellowship Grant […]
data.text:
“ Shortly after winning my grant, I found out a widely-recognized academic neurosurgical oncologist – who I greatly admired – had reviewed my proposal and he gave me personal feedback. It was an honor and also pointed to how the academic neurosurgical community invested a great amount of time in this program. Looking at the alumni of the NREF research fellowship is like looking at an academic neurosurgery honor roll. The study I initiated details characteristics and career outcomes of the NREF recipients, highlights how important this grant process has been in supporting the creation of surgeon scientists. “

Analiz Rodriguez, MD, PhD, 2013-14 NREF Cerebrovascular Section Research Fellowship Grant

“ The recognition I received from the NREF served as a springboard for future research opportunities. I have been very fortunate with the trajectory of my career, and I have the NREF to thank. The NREF provides funding to students and early investigators that leads to great discoveries. Today, I support the NREF not only with my Cushing Circle donations, but also by directing great students to apply for the Medical Student Summer Research Fellowship. It’s the ‘circle of life’. “

G. Edward Vates, MD, PhD, FAANS, 2006-07 NREF Young Clinician Investigator Award recipient and NREF Cushing Circle of Giving member
